As a student in this school, I feel like making some annoymous complaints. Firstly, the students are extremely loud, rude and uncooperative to their teachers. I always hear people shouting and loud chattering near by the main staircase after recess, do the teachers never teach them on how to line up in two's aswell? I find the extra noise quite frustrating and difficult to focus during lessons as I'm easily distracted by noise. Secondly, some students may need to learn some manners as I've witness some of my classmates completely disrespecting and making a fool out of the teachers. Thirdly, I take notice of my fellow schoolmates behavior after classes are over. I see the upper-primary girls whipping out their phones right after class ends taking a stroll around the school while talking loudly on school campus. Another thing I would like to address is public transports. I see a repeating pattern of students from different levels all chattering loudly together on the bus. Sometimes, I might catch sight of some students eating on the bus as well. If your students keep up this behavior, this may ruin your school's reputation and may worry some parents who plan to enroll their children here.

-Written by one of your students, annoymously.

School counselling and support for mental health/disability is nonexistent. Teachers do not think that the severity of our mental health is much to impact ourselves and everyone around us just because we are still single digits in age. Teachers would make students cater and care for autistic students even if they are not even aware of the term ‚Äúmentally disabled yet‚Äù. The same goes for suicidal and mentally unwell students, they push those kids onto other students, expecting them to cater to them automatically. I have started seeing a trend in that school that student problems are always pushed onto other students and are not supported well by the teachers at all.

The school facilities are alright. Canteen food will spoil you, and I still miss the garlic bread from one of the nicest Aunties there. I heard good reviews of the camp from P3-P6. Since Covid is getting lighter, I do hope your kids enjoy it.

Overall, it is not a horrible school, in fact I think that it is mediocre at best. But if your children are showing signs of lethargy and despair, I recommend you check on them yourself, do not leave it to the staff at OLN.
